bin.Benchmark_ML module¶

bin.Data module¶

class bin.Data.DataStream(*header)[source]¶

Bases: object

Simple decorator class to facilitate data handling and passing data from stage to stage during data processing, without having to care about how the data is handled. The internal data structure is intended to be marshallable into human-readable standard output.

bin.Import module¶

bin.Import.import_RIS(source)[source]¶

Converts RIS into a DataStream. Takes input as an iterator in order to allow any type of source. Therefore source loading is expected to be handles by the caller.

bin.Import.import_bibreview_xml(source)[source]¶

Converts BibReview XML into a DataStream. Takes xml input as a string in order to allow any type of source. Therefore source loading is expected to be handles by the caller. Since BibReview does not support structured abstracts, keywords, or publication_types, these fields will be empty. Users are advised to reretrieve the results from PubMed if these are required.

bin.Import.import_csv(source)[source]¶

Converts a comma separated file into a DataStream.

bin.Import.import_embase_xml(source)[source]¶

Converts Embase XML into a DataStream. Takes xml input as a string in order to allow any type of source. Therefore source loading is expected to be handles by the caller.

bin.Import.import_endnote_xml(source)[source]¶

Converts EndNote XML into DataStream. Takes xml input as a string in order to allow any type of source. Therefore source loading is expected to be handles by the caller. Since EndNote does not support structured abstracts, keywords, or publication_types, these fields will be empty.

bin.Import.import_pmids(source)[source]¶

Converts a list of pmids into a DataStream.

bin.Import.import_tsv(source)[source]¶

Converts a tab separated file into a DataStream.

bin.Medline module¶

bin.Medline.add_pmids_from_dois(email, records)[source]¶
bin.Medline.convert_document_id(doc_id, email, id_type='PMC')[source]¶

Convert document id to dictionary of other id see: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/tools/id-converter-api/ for more info Based on: https://github.com/titipata/pubmed_parser/blob/master/pubmed_parser/pubmed_web_parser.py

bin.Medline.retrieve_by_pmid(email, input_records)[source]¶

Retrieves abstracts and metadata from PubMed. Input should at least have a PMID field. All field values are retained in the output, but the order of the fields is not guaranteed to be preserved. This function is _not_ reentrant unless the email given is constant from call to call.

bin.Medline.retrieve_by_query(email, queries, offset=0, n=100)[source]¶

This function is _not_ reentrant unless the email given is constant from call to call.

bin.Medline.retrieve_fulltext(email, input_records)[source]¶

Retrieves fulltext articles from PubMed Central. Input should at least have a PMID field. All field values are retained in the output, but the order of the fields is not guaranteed to be preserved. This function is _not_ reentrant unless the email given is constant from call to call.

bin.Singleton module¶

class bin.Singleton.Singleton(decorated)[source]¶

Bases: object

A non-thread-safe helper class to ease implementing singletons. This should be used as a decorator – not a metaclass – to the class that should be a singleton.

The decorated class can define one __init__ function that takes only the self argument. Also, the decorated class cannot be inherited from. Other than that, there are no restrictions that apply to the decorated class.

To get the singleton instance, use the Instance method. Trying to use __call__ will result in a TypeError being raised.

Instance()[source]¶

Returns the singleton instance. Upon its first call, it creates a new instance of the decorated class and calls its __init__ method. On all subsequent calls, the already created instance is returned.

fit_transform(X, y=None, **fit_params)[source]¶

Fit to data, then transform it.

Fits transformer to X and y with optional parameters fit_params and returns a transformed version of X.

Xnumpy array of shape [n_samples, n_features]

Training set.

ynumpy array of shape [n_samples]

Target values.

X_newnumpy array of shape [n_samples, n_features_new]

Transformed array.

transform(X, y=None, **fit_params)[source]¶
class bin.misc.ObjectBuilder(type_defs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Takes a structure of dicts, list, and objects and constructs an object based on the type definitions given at construction. By convention (or by definition), capitalized dict entries are treated as classes, and non-capitalized dict entries are treated normally. Thus, {Foo: [1, 2, 3]} would construct a Foo object with 1, 2, 3 as arguments, provided a Foo class is defined in the ‘type_def’ argument to the constructor. Named arguments can be passed only in lower case, e.g. {SVC: {class_weight: ‘balanced’, tol: 0.01}}. I.e. {SVC: {C: 1}} is not supported at present. This class is mainly intended to provide a base for constructing domain languages for pipeline construction. Examples can be found in the ‘data/param’ directory (in YAML).

parse(param)[source]¶

Construct an object from the given structure.

class bin.misc.Prototype(klass)[source]¶

Bases: object

Implementation of the Prototype patterns without resorting to deepcopying. This should therefore be safe to use even for classes that cannot be cloned such as files, sockets, or tensorflow models (which depend on gpu state)
